item.title: Mexico Breaks Off Relations With Ecuador After Embassy Raid
item.description: Ecuadorean police entered the Mexican embassy in Quito to arrest a former vice president who had been granted asylum.

item.description: The last moments of the World Central Kitchen aid workers who died earlier this week.

item.description: Cherry blossoms in Japan, Basketball’s Final Four and other images from across the world, selected by Wall Street Journal photo editors.

item.title: Return of Palestinians to Gaza's North Emerges as Issue in Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: CIA Director William Burns is heading to Cairo to push Israel and Hamas to reach an agreement on the release of hostages.

item.title: Inside the U.S. Golf Association's Agenda: Sustainability and Rollbacks
item.description: CEO Mike Whan talks about what is behind the rising interest in the game, and why he had to limit how far balls could travel.

item.title: Contaminated Fuel Is a Hard-to-Fix Problem in Ocean Shipping
item.description: “Cappuccino” and the improper mixing of oils aboard ships plague the industry as investigators probe the cause of the cargo vessel Dali’s crash into Baltimore’s Francis Scott Key Bridge.

item.title: The Nightmare Loss that Led to Purdue's Dream Season
item.description: A year ago, the Boilermakers suffered one of the most embarrassing defeats in March Madness history. Now, they’re on the doorstep of their program’s first national championship.

item.title: How a $1,250 Mary-Jane Shoe Became a Rare Luxury Megahit
item.description: Alaïa’s rubber-soled ‘ballerine’ has earned fans for its counterintuitive combination of glitz and comfort: “It’s always sold out.”

item.description: They got a sleep divorce. Their marriage has never been better.

item.description: Veteran law enforcers are stunned by the level of violence as the gang boss known as Izo expands his control.

item.title: The Race to Keep an Amtrak Train From Falling Into the Pacific
item.description: The Pacific Surfliner has shut down frequently because of coastal erosion and eventually must be moved inland.

item.description: The SEC won its “shadow trading’” case, extending the application of the law.

item.description: I never got my degree and I have lots of student debt. And yet…

item.title: The Calls for Help Coming From Above the Poverty Line
item.description: The operators taking America’s distress calls say they hear from more people who earn too much to be eligible for many social services.

item.title: Trump Will Raise $43 Million in One Night, but He's Still Courting His Biggest 2020 Donor
item.description: The former president is chasing big-name holdouts among Republican contributors to previous campaigns.

item.title: Caitlin Clark's Perfect Ending vs. South Carolina's Perfect Season
item.description: The Iowa superstar is one win from ending her college career with the national championship she craves. Standing in her way is the undefeated juggernaut of women’s basketball.
